item.description:
Turning off of NH-28 (Pinewood Road) in Allenstown where you see the sign for Bear Brook State Park proceed 3.2 miles on Deerfield Road. Having just pasted a cemetery on your right, turn right onto Podunk Road where you will see the sign in the first picture. Proceed 0.3 miles and turn right into the parking lot just before where the road splits at the toll booth (picture 3).

If you are traveling on Deerfield Rd coming from Deerfield just after the sign for Bear Brook Stables (picture 2) turn left onto Podunk Road at the sign in picture one. The two signs are visible from one another.

Please note that Podunk Road runs both through Allenstown and Candia and is the same road.  However, because the road is gated closed much of the way make sure your GPS sends you to the Allenstown end of Podunk Road as you won't be able drive through to the other end if you end up in Candia.  Another address that puts you very near Podunk Rd in Allenstown that your GPS should not confuse is 334 Deerfield Road, Allenstown, NH.  That is the address for Bear Brook Stables.

The hike will be an approximately 5.3 miles long, loop hike and will start on the Bear Brook Trail (scenic views of Bear Brook), continues on to a short section of the Lane Trail (dirt road) to One Mile Road (a dirt road), then takes the Catamount Hill Trail to the top of Catamount Hill (751 ft. elevation, where there are several views from semi-open ledges). Next the Cascade Trail (views of small cascades on Catamount Brook) brings us back to the Lane Trail and Bear Brook Trail which we will follow in reverse back to the parking lot.  The total elevation gain for this hike is approximately 600 feet.

Here is a link to a trail map:

 http://www.nhstateparks.org/uploads/pdf/BearBrookTrailsMap_2011-web.pdf

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Bear Brook State Park - Catamount Hill & Bear Brook
